title:
A consistency-stability approach to scaling limits of zero-range
  processes
authors: Daniel Marahrens, Angeliki Menegaki, Cl\'ement Mouhot
abstract:
We propose a simple quantitative method for studying the hydrodynamic limit
of interacting particle systems on lattices. It is applied to the diffusive
scaling of the symmetric Zero-Range Process (in dimensions one and two). The
rate of convergence is estimated in a Monge-Kantorovich distance asymptotic to
the L^1 stability estimate of Kruzkhov, as well as in relative entropy; and it
is uniform in time. The method avoids the use of the so-called ``block
estimates''. It is based on a modulated Monge-Kantorovich distance estimate and
microscopic stability properties.
